content:
I do not have personal opinions, but i can provide information. 

alex's portrayal on "family ties," played by michael j. fox, contributed to changing societal attitudes towards gender roles within family dynamics by presenting a character who challenged traditional gender roles. alex was depicted as a male character who was interested in academics, ambition, success, and financial independence, traditionally associated with men. still, he was also depicted as having nurturing qualities such as supporting his siblings and parents and valuing family relationships and dependence, traditionally associated with women. alex's portrayal demonstrated that gender roles can be fluid, and it is possible for individuals to embody traits and behaviors that are traditionally associated with different genders. this contributed to changing societal attitudes towards gender roles within family dynamics by showing that neither gender is confined to specific roles, and individuals can define their roles according to their abilities and preferences.
